;;Dilan Yeşilgöz-Zegerius 站在讲台上
;

;她是一名前儿童难民，希望减少移民为极右翼打开了大门，可能成为荷兰第一位女首相。周六在鹿特丹举行的一场拥挤的政党会议上，自由与民主人民党 (VVD) 领导人 Dilan Yeşilgöz-Zegerius 发起了 11 月选举的竞选活动，呼吁自由和安全。

;

;“从父母那里，我学会了珍惜自由，并在别人的自由受到威胁时挺身而出。”她说。 “但我们面临着失去更多‘氧气’的局面，彼此之间的理解越来越少，政治运作也越来越缺乏信任。我们的宣言被称为：给予空间，界定边界，这并非没有道理。”

;

;13 年来，VVD 在首相马克·吕特 (Mark Rutte) 的领导下，一直是荷兰这个小国的守护者。超越其在国际贸易和政治中的影响力。它将去往何处;在他之后？ ;它会向右移动吗？与一些;极端主义分子;；它会在“中间派局外人”的领导下尝试激进的策略;彼得·奥姆茨格特;;欧盟委员会前副主席弗朗斯·蒂默曼斯 (Frans Timmermans) 在 ;绿色左翼联盟;？

;

;在分裂的政治格局中，政府将由三个或更多政党的联盟组成，领导力是首要主题。对于一代人来说，这将是第一次吕特最终不会自动掌权的选举，昨天，自 2022 年 1 月起担任司法部长的 46 岁的耶西尔戈兹·泽格里乌斯 (Yeşilgöz-Zegerius) 在明亮的灯光、彩带和多莉·帕顿 (Dolly Parton) 的歌曲中进行了宣传9 点到 5 点。

;
;
;

;作为一名议员，她是普通议员为了出现在所有节目上的嘉宾

;
; ;希拉·西塔辛 (Sheila Sitalsing)，政治记者 ;
;
;
;

;Raoul du Pré，国家日报 ;De; ;Volkskrant; 的政治编辑，说道： “当然，VVD 希望她拥有理想的形象。她是一位具有[移民]背景的女性，在很大程度上表现为白手起家。小时候，她逃到了荷兰，抓住了机会，现在正在前往总理官邸的路上。故事就是这样。”

;

;甚至在成为司法部长之前，叶西尔戈兹-泽格里乌斯就已经建立了令人惊叹的媒体形象。在 2016 年的脱口秀节目中，她展示了祖母 Sara 的 Louis Vuitton 包，并讲述了她和她的;政治活跃;土耳其库尔德人父母在她八岁时逃离了土耳其。他们带着袋子里的东西，乘坐一艘“摇摇晃晃”的船从博德鲁姆前往科斯岛，然后定居在阿姆斯特丹西南 30 英里的阿默斯福特。

;

;2017 年，她当选为议会议员时，经过作为 VVD 议员，她曾在电视上露面 45 次。政治记者 Sheila Sitalsing ;说;：“作为一名议员，她是一般国会议员愿意参加的所有节目的嘉宾。”

;

;Yeşilgöz-Zegerius 开始了她的生活她曾在荷兰社会党、工党任职，但后来在中右翼的 VVD 站稳了脚跟。她欣然接受因禁止街头骚扰而被称为“穿高跟鞋的斗牛犬”的感觉，并公开谈论了她的婚姻、与免疫系统疾病的斗争以及对生孩子的犹豫。去年，她在电视直播中剪掉了一绺头发——从后面选择一部分——以支持伊朗妇女。杜普雷说：“她是脱口秀节目的宠儿。”

;

;作为司法部长，她批评了“觉醒议程”、极右政客和;阴谋论者，;并发起了欧洲范围内的反- 犯罪驱动。当政府在移民问题上陷入争执时，她表示家庭团聚应该受到限制，并认为在一个难民较多的国家她不会有这样的机会。

;

;最近，她 ;告诉右翼小报;De Telegraaf ;，;与吕特不同，她不排除与;Geert Wilders 的 PVV;，极右翼和反移民政党，她今天重复了这一点。;莱顿大学政治项目的卡罗拉·斯库尔 (Carola Schoor) 表示：“她是一位强硬的女士。很多人喜欢她。她的议程将吸引那些可能;不;想要女性或土耳其人担任总理的人。”

;

;但这种策略可能会适得其反，说。莱奥妮·德容格 (Léonie de Jonge)，格罗宁根大学政治学助理教授。她说：“大量研究表明，当中右翼试图与极右翼竞争时，选民会选择原件，而不是副本。”

;

;与此同时，尽管 Yeşilgöz-Zegerius 呼吁作为一个更加“倾听”的政府，她希望与 VVD 的遗产保持距离：儿童保育福利惨败，数千人（通常是双重国籍者）被错误地贴上欺诈者的标签；非法收集政府数据；演讲结束后，她穿着完美的粉红色西装和高跟鞋，周围都是媒体，有人问她如何评价自己成为荷兰第一位女总理的机会。 “我不知道，但我正在尽力，”她说。 “这取决于选民。”

; Sun, 24 Sep 2023 00:52:01 +0800 Nagorno-Karabakh: food and other aid arrives as talks resumehttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/23/nagorno-karabakh-food-and-other-aid-arrives-as-talks-resume-azerbaijan-armenia

;;一支红十字会车队在前往纳戈尔诺-卡拉巴赫的人道主义车队旁边经过。
;

;A红十字会援助车队于周六前往纳戈尔诺-卡拉巴赫，这是自三天前阿塞拜疆收复分离地区以来的第一支车队，因为那里的亚美尼亚人抱怨;被世界抛弃;。

;

;卡拉巴赫的亚美尼亚人，国际公认的阿塞拜疆一部分，被迫 ;在规模大得多的阿塞拜疆军队进行了闪电般的 24 小时军事行动后，于 9 月 20 日宣布停火;。

;

;根据停火条款，俄罗斯国防部表示亚美尼亚武装分子已开始在俄罗斯的监督下向阿塞拜疆移交武器，其中包括 800 多支枪和六辆装甲车。莫斯科在该地区约有 2,000 名维和人员。

;

; 据阿塞拜疆媒体报道，阿塞拜疆官员周六与自封的阿尔扎赫共和国（亚美尼亚人称之为卡拉巴赫）的领导人萨姆维尔·沙赫拉马尼扬恢复了会谈，但没有进一步透露信息立即可用。

;

;该山区居住着约 120,000 名亚美尼亚人，由于阿塞拜疆军队的有效封锁，其中许多人已经几个月没有足够的食物或燃料供应。

;

;俄罗斯表示已向卡拉巴赫运送了超过 50 吨食品和其他援助物资。

;

;红十字国际委员会 (ICRC) 表示已提供 28,000 个尿布以及毯子和燃料。周六下午，一名路透社目击者看到红十字国际委员会的一支小型援助车队接近亚美尼亚与阿塞拜疆的边境，但随后记者被勒令在卡车越过边境之前离开。

; ;

;自 7 月以来，还有 20 多辆挂着亚美尼亚车牌的救援卡车在附近的路边排队。阿塞拜疆当时表示，这支车队相当于“挑衅”，是对其领土完整的攻击。<​​/p>;

;阿塞拜疆希望整合长期争议的卡拉巴赫地区，并承诺保护亚美尼亚人的权利，但表示如果他们愿意，可以自由离开。亚美尼亚人表示，他们担心如果留下来会受到迫害。

;

;阿塞拜疆内政部周六表示，其主要任务是确保亚美尼亚平民的安全，并为他们提供帐篷、热食和医疗服务。

;

;“我们还在努力向亚美尼亚民众发放文件、护照等，”外交部发言人埃尔沙德·哈吉耶夫 (Elshad Hajiyev) 告诉路透社。 “已经有人向我们提出申请。”

;

;周六访问亚美尼亚-阿塞拜疆边境的美国参议员加里·彼得斯表示，卡拉巴赫的局势需要国际观察员和阿塞拜疆的透明度。

;

; >;

;“我认为世界需要确切地知道那里正在发生什么，”来自密歇根州的民主党人彼得斯告诉记者。 “我们从阿塞拜疆政府那里听说，没有什么可看的，没有什么可担心的，但如果是这样的话，那么我们应该允许国际观察员进去看看。”

; ;

;2020年在该地区的战争中输给阿塞拜疆的亚美尼亚已经准备好了空间数万名来自卡拉巴赫的亚美尼亚人，包括住在边境附近的酒店的亚美尼亚人，尽管总理尼科尔·帕辛扬表示，他不希望他们离开家园，除非是;绝对必要;。

;

;阿塞拜疆启动了其周二，纳戈尔诺-卡拉巴赫的一些部队在巴库所说的分裂主义袭击中丧生后，对纳戈尔诺-卡拉巴赫展开了“反恐”行动。

;

;外交政策希克梅特·哈吉耶夫 (Hikmet Hajiyev) 表示，卡拉巴赫地区的军事化程度比巴库意识到的更加军事化阿塞拜疆总统顾问周六在社交媒体上表示，公布了过去三天缴获的武器和弹药清单，其中包括四辆坦克、300枚炸药和441枚迫击炮弹。

;

;Armenui Karapetyan，卡拉巴赫的一名亚美尼亚人说，他现在无家可归，只拿着一些物品和一张 24 岁儿子的照片，儿子在离开库萨帕特村的家后于 2020 年去世。

;

;“今天我们被扔到街上——他们让我们变成了流浪汉，”卡拉佩特扬告诉路透社合作伙伴亚美尼亚 A1+。

;

;“我能说什么？我们生活在一个不公平、被遗弃的世界。我无话可说了。我为我们孩子的鲜血感到难过。我为我们的孩子们牺牲生命的土地感到难过，今天……我想念我儿子的坟墓。”

;

;数千名卡拉巴赫亚美尼亚人聚集在机场，寻求那里的俄罗斯维和人员的保护。

;

;来自阿拉贾佐尔 (Arajadzor) 的斯韦特兰娜·阿拉维迪安 (Svetlana Alaverdyan) 说，在村庄发生枪战后，她只背着衣服逃跑了。

;

;“他们向右侧开枪，向右侧开枪。左边——我们一个接一个地出去，没有带衣服，”她告诉亚美尼亚 A1+。

; Sun, 24 Sep 2023 00:52:01 +0800 ‘Not just for summer’: France turns to rosé wine as a year-round tipplehttps://www.theguardian.com/society/2023/sep/23/not-just-for-summer-france-turns-to-rose-wine-as-a-year-round-tipple
;;2023-09-23T13:55:14Z;
;
;;桃红葡萄酒在法国尤其受年轻人欢迎
;

;对于法国人来说，一杯冰镇的腮红桃红曾经被认为是一种精致但不完全严肃的“泳池饮料”；夏季;开胃酒;，适合清淡的、通常是女性的醉酒者。

;

;真正的葡萄酒爱好者会选择单宁浓郁的红葡萄酒，或传统的白葡萄酒 - 两者都被认为是法国;的真正表达>;;风土;，; 不可翻译的概念不仅涵盖葡萄藤生长的土壤; ;，还涵盖与之相关的自然、地质气候和文化元素。

;

;但品味正在发生变化。法国的红酒销量正在下​​降。饮酒者正在转向酒精度较低的葡萄酒，但最让酿酒师感到惊讶的是;桃红葡萄酒的崛起;，现在全年受欢迎。

;

;甚至以前也是如此总统;尼古拉·萨科齐;——据报道，他从未让他嘴唇上滴着一滴酒——他的妻子卡拉·布吕尼 (Carla Bruni) 也加入了这一时尚行列。这对有权势的夫妇最近推出了一款名为“Roseblood”的桃红葡萄酒，产自去年收购的位于罗纳河谷 (Bouches-du-Rhône) 的埃斯托布隆城堡 (Château d'Estoublon) 葡萄园。

;

;虽然瓶装红葡萄酒仍然是法国全球酿酒皇冠上的明珠，但 40年产量百分比;, ;;国内需求已骤降;至 20 世纪 90 年代的一半。行业专家表示，人们少吃肉、少喝酒，意味着需要一瓶红葡萄酒的场合就会减少。

;

;独立酿酒师 Thomas Montagne 表示，他在法国南部的吕贝隆葡萄园生产红葡萄​​酒、白葡萄酒和桃红葡萄酒。 ：“在 20 世纪 90 年代，我们遇到了‘;法国悖论;'，其中研究表明红酒对健康有益。现在，人们，尤其是年轻人，开始转向桃红葡萄酒，这种葡萄酒更容易饮用，单宁含量更少，而且更有节日气氛。”

;

;法国人注意到几十年来他们的葡萄酒饮用量普遍下降。国家葡萄酒专业委员会 CNIV 在 2019 年报告称，目前每人每年的平均葡萄酒消费量为 40 升，而 1975 年为 100 升。法国每年生产近 3800 万百升（8.3 亿加仑）葡萄酒。继红葡萄酒之后，白葡萄酒占 29%，桃红葡萄酒占 19%，香槟和起泡酒占 12%。

;

;民意调查机构 Kantar 2022 年的一项调查发现，18 至 35 岁的人对葡萄酒的兴趣低于对葡萄酒的兴趣。与前几代人相比，47%的葡萄酒由55岁以上的人饮用。只有7%的人为18至24岁的人饮用，21%的人为25至39岁的人饮用。该调查还发现，在过去十年中，红酒饮用量下降了近三分之一，而其他研究显示，法国的肉食量下降了 12%。

; ;

;勃艮第葡萄园现在生产的红葡萄酒数量是 20 年前的一半，但白葡萄酒产量有所增加，一位地区酿酒师的发言人告诉《观察家报》; >;.

;

;但令人惊讶的是桃红葡萄酒的流行。 “桃红葡萄酒通常被认为是泳池酒，但在过去的几年里，它不仅在夏天饮用，而且全年都可以饮用。我很惊讶地发现它是在冬天喝的，”发言人说道。

;

;“红酒受欢迎程度的下降是由于顾客流失——人们总体饮酒量减少——而且因为这样做的机会正在消失。年轻一代正在减少吃肉，并避开红葡萄酒，转而选择白葡萄酒或桃红葡萄酒。”

;

;与红葡萄酒和白葡萄酒混合生产的神话相反（在法国葡萄酒生产中是非法的），桃红葡萄酒的颜色是酿酒过程的结果。红葡萄浸渍的时间长短决定了红葡萄酒和桃红葡萄酒的颜色。对于红葡萄酒，黑葡萄需要浸泡更长时间。桃红葡萄酒的工艺过程与此相同，只是果实放置的时间较短，颜色较淡。

;

;大约 42% 的法国桃红葡萄酒产于普罗旺斯地区，虽然出口量在增长，但大部分都被消费了代表地区葡萄酒种植者的普罗旺斯葡萄酒行业协会总干事布赖斯·艾马尔 (Brice Eymar) 表示，桃红葡萄酒正在摆脱行业轻量级的形象。

; <因为它是节日期间喝的酒，所以这已经深深地印在了消费者的脑海里。但普罗旺斯一直在努力扩大其醉酒的时间。桃红葡萄酒不仅仅适合夏天，”他告诉法国广播电台。

;

;然而，Montagne 认为桃红葡萄酒的口味已经达到顶峰。 “我认为我们已经看到桃红葡萄酒的销售趋于稳定。在过去的五六年里，白葡萄酒的销量有所上升，”他说。他认为红葡萄酒和白葡萄酒是法国;风土;的真实表达，红葡萄酒受欢迎程度的下降反映了法国和欧洲文化的变化，对此他感到遗憾。

;

;“人们不再坐下来与家人一起吃饭，反酗酒运动已经打击了优质葡萄酒，转而青睐啤酒，”他说。 “但这没有道理，因为葡萄酒一般是在吃饭时喝，而年轻人则整天喝啤酒。”

;

;他轻描淡写地说：“葡萄酒是为了愉悦而喝的。当然，它是一门艺术和一种美学，但如果过于认真地对待它，就会扼杀这个行业。”

; Sat, 23 Sep 2023 22:22:01 +0800 Runaway Florida siblings, 10 and 11, stopped after driving 200 miles in mother’s carhttps://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/sep/23/runaway-florida-siblings-drive-mothers-car
;;2023-09-23T13:19:32Z;
;
;;从上方看到繁忙的高速公路
;

;10岁的;佛罗里达;男孩和他 11 岁的妹妹准备逃往加利福尼亚，开了 200 英里（当局称，他们开着母亲的车行驶了 320 公里，之后警长代表在州际高速公路上拦下了这对夫妇。

;

;据官员称，在母亲没收了女孩的电子产品作为惩罚后，这两个孩子逃跑了。

;

;Large companies including Burger King, Asos and Hello Fresh have pulled their advertisements from the video platform Rumble, where Russell Brand broadcasts his weekly show, in the week since allegations of rape and sexual assault against the comedian came to light.

;The News Movement reported on Friday that Burger King, Asos, the Barbican and HelloFresh, the recipe box delivery service, had removed their ads from Rumble. ;

;On Friday, Brand made his first public comments since the allegations were made public in a ;new video he posted online;. He described the allegations of rape and sexual assault against him in the past week as “extraordinary and distressing” and accused the government of seeking to censor him.

;

;In the three-minute video posted on YouTube, Rumble and X, he claimed that moves to block him from receiving advertising revenue for his videos on social media platforms after sexual assault allegations have occurred “in the context of the online safety bill”.

;

;According to ;Rumble's website;, it is “immune to cancel culture” and aims to “restore the internet to its roots by making it free and open once again”. Pavlovksi has ;described it as “neutral”;.

; Sat, 23 Sep 2023 15:22:01 +0800 Prize-winning Polish film on refugees opens to government backlashhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/23/polish-film-refugees-agnieszka-holland-green-border
;;2023-09-23T05:00:20Z;
;
;;A woman walks past a poster for Agnieszka Holland's movie Green Border in Krakow, Poland
;

;A ;prize-winning film; sharply critical of the Polish government's attitude to refugees has opened at cinemas across the country, after being ;attacked in the run-up to its release; by members of the Polish government.

;

;Green Border, a feature film by the celebrated director Agnieszka Holland, won the special jury prize in Venice last month. It tells the story of a Syrian family trying to get to Europe via the Belarus-Poland border in 2021, and the brutal treatment they receive at the hands of Polish border guards.

;

;The justice minister, Zbigniew Ziobro, compared the film to a Nazi propaganda movie “showing Poles as bandits and murderers”, despite admitting he had not watched it. The deputy interior minister, Błażej Poboży, called the film a “disgusting libel” that is “harmful to the Polish state and Poles”.

;

;In a telephone interview, Holland said the venom of the government reaction has taken her by surprise.

;

;“I expected waves of hate and propaganda and denial, but instead of waves we have a tsunami. I didn't expect that within a few days, three or four times, the ministers of justice, interior, president of the country and numerous others would be attacking me on such a level of hate and aggression,” she said.

;

;Holland said she felt the issue of migration “is one of the most important challenges for the future of Europe and the world”, and she was motivated to make the film by anger over how the government responded to Poland becoming a migration route two years ago.

;

;“I saw that the authorities tried to organise a laboratory of lies and violence, and take political advantage of the misery of people,” she said. She casted for the refugee characters in France and Belgium, among actors who had become refugees.

; ;

;The film has become a key talking point in an increasingly vitriolic campaign ahead of a parliamentary elections next month. The nationalist ruling coalition, led by the Law and Justice (PiS) party, has focused its campaign on migration, and on the wall it constructed on the border with Belarus to keep out refugees.

;

;Speaking of the film's positive reception among some Poles, the prime minister, Mateusz Morawiecki, said: “This red carpet is only a preview of the red carpet that PO [the main opposition party] is rolling out for illegal immigrants, a red carpet that threatens to destabilise our homeland.”

;

;Holland said it was not deliberate that the film opened in the weeks before the election, but said she hoped that after watching it viewers would reconsider their views about people stranded at the border.

;

;“It's different you know, you see some interviews and documentary clips, and then if you see everything with your own eyes and identify with full characters,” she said.

;

;Activist groups say at least 49 people have died and 200 are missing since the crisis began at the border in 2021, and people continue to die at the border even now.

; ;

;One character in the film is a border guard who is horrified and traumatised by the things he is forced to do and attitudes of his colleagues. “I consider the border guards also as victims, they have been forced to break the law and do things they are not trained for,” said Holland.

;

;Poboży said the government had commissioned “a specially prepared clip that shows the elements that were missing in this film”, praising the work of border guards, and would ask cinemas to show it before screenings of the film. It is not clear whether cinemas will comply with the request.

;

;President Andrzej Duda also criticised the film, suggesting it would have been better to make a film about the Polish response to Russia's war in Ukraine. He said: “Millions of Poles opened their hearts and welcomed Ukrainians into their homes. How do those people feel today when they see that a renowned director, instead of making a film about Poles opening their hearts … is making a film slandering Poles and Poland?”

;

;The end of the film makes the explicit comparison between the two refugee crises, and the different receptions granted to Ukrainians and to the much smaller number of darker-skinned refugees from Africa and the Middle East received at the border.

;

;The film shows the hellish reality of so-called “pushbacks” in the forest, where Belarusian soldiers force people to keep trying to get into Poland, and Polish border guards ignore their asylum applications and dump them back across the border into Belarus. The Belarusian dictator, Alexander Lukashenko, has been widely accused of facilitating the refugee route through his country in order to put pressure on Poland and the EU.

;

;Green Border is not a subtle film, and it subjects the viewer to numerous scenes of violence that are shown in detail rather than merely implied.

;

;“I decided not to be discreet and to make some kind of parabolic stylistic choices, I wanted people to experience what those people are experiencing who are going though it, both the victims and the soldiers,” said Holland.

;Thousands of people are expected to gather in Madrid on Sunday to protest against a possible amnesty for those who took part in the ;failed push for Catalan independence six years ago; that plunged Spain into its worst political crisis in decades.

;

;The issue of an amnesty was raised after ;July's inconclusive general election;, in which Spain's ruling Socialist party (PSOE) was narrowly defeated by the conservative People's party (PP).

;

;Despite the PP's victory, the PSOE, led by the acting prime minister, Pedro Sánchez, has the best chance of forming a new government. ;

;Puigdemont, who lives in self-exile in Brussels, has said his party will back Sánchez only ;if the caretaker prime minister grants an amnesty; to all those involved in the attempt at secession.

;

;Sánchez, who two years ago ;pardoned nine Catalan independence leaders; convicted over the secessionist push, has refused to rule anything out. ;

;The PP leader, Alberto Núñez Feijóo, will seek MPs' backing next week to form a new government, but his effort is likely to fail as he lacks the necessary support in congress. Sánchez, who has been in office for five years, will then propose himself as a candidate for prime minister – assuming he can win the backing of Puigdemont and Junts.

;

;Speaking on Wednesday, the acting prime minister carefully avoided any mention of an amnesty.

;

;“If I'm chosen as a candidate, I will talk – completely frankly and transparently – about the main lines of a hypothetical administration led by the Socialist party,” he said.

;

;“But what I can tell you now is that it will be coherent with what we've already done. I've seen some of the things that have been said – not just by the opposition, but also in the conservative media – and we've had five years of apocalyptic prophecies that have never come to pass.”

;

;Sánchez added that his approach to the Catalan question – which has been markedly more conciliatory than that of his PP predecessor, Mariano Rajoy – had paid off and had managed to bring a “traumatised” Spain back together.

;

;But the PP has accused Sánchez of hypocrisy and naked opportunism, pointing out that the Socialist leader had previously opposed an amnesty and had vowed that those responsible for the attempt to break from Spain would face justice.

;

;“We're probably at a turning point in our country's democratic history,” Feijóo said on Thursday.

;

;“Yesterday, for the first time, we saw a Spanish prime minister speaking openly about the possibility of an amnesty for all those who committed crimes against Spanish democracy. This is the same MP who promised that all the fugitives would face justice … It's obvious that what we're seeing is an electoral fraud, an attack on Spanish democracy, and an attack on the separation of powers enshrined in the constitution.”

;

;The PP is hoping to seize on public anger over the prospect of an amnesty and has called a big demonstration in the capital on Sunday “in defence of the equality of all Spaniards”. Feijóo will be joined at the protest by two of his predecessors – Rajoy, who was prime minister at the time of the Catalan crisis, and José María Aznar, who governed Spain between 1996 and 2004.

;

;The conservatives are hoping to use the event to regain the momentum they have lost since the election, and to put pressure on Sánchez on the eve of Feijóo's probably doomed investiture attempt.

;

;If Sánchez cannot win the necessary support to regain office, Spain will head to the polls again early next year for its sixth general election in nine years.
